item.title: The Other Bubble
item.description: No one on the news had any idea how to cover it. No neighborhood reporter or Pulitzer Prize winning journalist. No local, national, or international program. Watching the news anchors try to piece it all together was almost funny. As experts on multiverse theory laid out long-winded analogies, their wrinkled foreheads betrayed the mental gymnastics being performed by their minds. “So, what you’re saying is, the very fabric of our world is being absorbed into theirs?

item.title: /about/
item.description: I graduated from Stanford with a B.S. in Computer Science in 2016 and worked as a software engineer at the financial technology startup Addepar until late 2020. I’m now at Princeton pursuing a Master’s in Computer Science. This website serves as a home for my writing ✍️, which ranges from sci-fi and magical realist fiction to long-form social and political commentary. I want to tell good stories and agitate for change.
